states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be an Alabama resident.
  • Be at least 18 years old.
  • NOT been convicted of a disqualifying felony.
  • NOT be declared mentally incompetent by a court.
states.online:
Items required

  • Valid Alabama driver's license or identification card

Steps

  1. Visit the state's Electronic Voter Registration Application and follow the prompts as you complete the online form.
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Valid Alabama driver's license or identification card

Steps

  1. Obtain State of Alabama Mail-In Voter Registration Form (Form NVRA-2) by mail by filling out the online form request, printing it out here, or by calling (800) 274-8683.
  2. Complete State of Alabama Mail-In Voter Registration Form (Form NVRA-2).
  3. Return form to
    • your local AL county office of Board of Registrars
    • an AL DMV driver licensing office when you apply for or renew your driver's license or ID card
    • any other government agency such as Medicaid agencies, Department of Human Resources, County public library.
states.mail:
Items required

  • Valid Alabama driver's license or identification card

Steps

  1. Obtain State of Alabama Mail-In Voter Registration Form (Form NVRA-2) by mail by filling out the online form request, printing it out here, or by calling (800) 274-8683.
  2. Complete State of Alabama Mail-In Voter Registration Form (Form NVRA-2).
  3. Return form to your local AL county office of Board of Registrars

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be a resident of Alaska.
  • Be at least 18 years old, or within 90 days of turning 18 years old.
  • NOT convicted and currently serving incarceration, parole, probation for a disqualifying felony*.
  • NOT be registered to vote in another state.
states.online:
Items required

  • Valid Alaska driver's license or ID card

Steps

  1. Visit the state's Online Voter Registration System. and follow the prompts asyou complete the online form.
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Valid Alaska driver's license or ID card

Steps

  1. Register to vote or update your registration in person at a Division of Elections Office, or visit a voter registration agency in your area.
states.mail:
Items required

  • Valid Alaska driver's license or ID card

Steps

  1. Print a paper form to complete and sign.
  2. Send your completed form by mail, fax or email attachment to a Regional Elections Office.
  3. Send a copy of either your current driver’s license, state ID, passportor birth certificate with your paper form.

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be a resident of the Arizona county listed on your registration.
  • Be at least 18 years old on or before the date of the next general election.
  • NOT disqualified from voting at this time due to felony conviction(s).
  • NOT be declared 'incompetent' by a court.
  • Must register to vote at least 29 days before the next election to be able to vote in it.
states.online:
Items required

  • Name, as it appears on your driver's license or ID card.
  • Address
  • Social Security number.

Steps

  1. Visit the state's Electronic Voter Registration Application and follow the prompts as you complete the online form.
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Proof of your U.S. citizenship, such as a photocopy of your birth certificate or U.S. passport.

Steps

  1. Pick up an Arizona Voter Registration Form form at your local County Recorder, or print it out here
  2. Complete the form.
  3. Return the form and your proof of U.S. citizenship to your local County Recorder.
  4. You can also register to vote at your local AZ MVD office when you apply for an Arizona driver's license or identification card.
states.mail:
Items required

  • Proof of your U.S. citizenship, such as a photocopy of your birth certificate or U.S. passport.

Steps

  1. Print the Arizona Voter Registration Form
  2. Complete the form.
  3. Mail the form and your proof of U.S. citizenship to your local County Recorder.

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be an Arkansas resident (residing in Arkansas at least 30 days prior to the first election in which you will vote).
  • Be age 18 or turn 18 on or before the next election.
  • Not be a convicted felon whose sentence has not been discharged or pardoned.
  • Not be presently adjudged as mentally incompetent as to your ability to vote by a court of competent jurisdiction.
states.online: none
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Valid Arkansas driver's license or identification card

Steps

You can complete an in-person voter registration at:

  • Your county clerk's office.
  • Any AR ODS location where you complete a paper form or have your information sent electronically.
  • Any public library or Arkansas State Library.
  • Any public assistance or disability agency.
  • Any military recruitment or National Guard office.
  • Local voter registration drives.
states.mail:
Items required

  • Valid Arkansas driver's license or identification card, or
  • A copy of a current utility bill, bank statement, government check or paycheck that shows your name and address, or
  • Another government document that shows your name and address

Steps

  1. Obtain Arkansas Voter Registration Application from your local county clerk's office, from the Arkansas Secretary of State, by calling the Secretary of State Elections Division at (800) 247-3312, by filling out the online form request, printing it out here.
  2. Complete the form
  3. Mail in the form on the address provided in the paper application.

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • A California resident.
  • 18 years old or older on Election Day.
  • Not currently in prison or on parole for a felony conviction. Note that Some citizens serving certain legal sentences can vote, and those with felony convictions who've had their civil rights restored can vote.
  • Not found to be mentally incompetent by a court.
states.online:
Items required

  • Your California driver license or California identification card number
  • The last four digits of your social security number
  • Your date of birth

Steps

  1. Visit the California Online Voter Registration and follow the prompts as you complete the online form.
states.inPerson: none
states.mail:
Items required

  • California driver's license or identification card number
  • Last 4 digits of your social security number

Steps

  1. Obtain National Mail Voter Registration Form by printing it here, pick a registration form up at your local DMV office or county elections office, or request one by calling the voter hotline at (800) 345-8683.
  2. Complete the form.
  3. Mail the form to the address provided on the application.

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • A Colorado resident who has lived in the state for at least 22 days before the election in which you plan to vote.
  • At least 18 years old by the date of the next election.
  • NOT currently serving a sentence of confinement, detention, or parole for a felony conviction.
states.online:
Items required

  • A valid Colorado driver's license, or
  • A Colorado ID card issued by the DMV.

Steps

  1. Visit the state's Electronic Voter Registration Application and follow the prompts as you complete the online form.
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Valid Colorado driver's license or identification card

Steps

You can complete an in-person voter registration at:

  • Your county clerk's office.
  • A Colorado DMV office when you apply for or renew your driver's license.
  • Public assistance offices.
  • Military recruitment offices.
  • Voter service and polling centers.
states.mail:
Items required

  • Valid Colorado driver's license or identification card

Steps

  1. Print the Colorado Voter Registration Form* (Form 100) here, or pick up this form directly from your county clerk's office.
  2. Complete the form.
  3. Return form to your county clerk's office

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • A resident of Connecticut.
  • At least 17 years old to register, and must be 18 years old on or before Election Day.
  • NOT be imprisoned or on parole. Voting rights are automatically restored upon the release of incarceration and, if applicable, parole.
states.online:
Items required

  • Valid CT driver's license, permit, or photo ID card, and a signature on file with the DMV.

Steps

  1. Visit the state's Online Voter Registration System and follow the prompts as you complete the online form.
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Valid CT driver's license, permit, or photo ID card

Steps

  1. Obtain State of Connecticut Mail-In Voter Registration (Form ED-671 S) here
  2. Complete the form.
  3. Return form to your local town hall or voter registration office. Locations found here
states.mail:
Items required

  • Valid CT driver's license, permit, or photo ID card

Steps

  1. Obtain State of Connecticut Mail-In Voter Registration (Form ED-671 S) here
  2. Complete the form.
  3. Mail form to your local town hall or voter registration office. Address found here

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • You're a Delaware citizen.
  • You're at least 18 years old.
  • You have not been deemed mentally incompetent.
  • You have not committed a disqualifying felony.
  • If applicable, you are no longer incarcerated, on parole, or on probation.
states.online: none
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Valid Delaware driver's license or photo ID card
  • Proof of residency via current utility bill, bank statement, or government paystub.

Steps

You can complete an in-person voter registration at:

  • your local Department of Elections
  • Your local Delaware DMV office if you're applying, renewing, or updating your DE driver's license or state ID card.
  • Department of Health and Social Services.
  • Department of Labor.
states.mail:
Items required

  • Delaware driver's license or ID number.
  • If you have neither, provide your Social Security number.

Steps

  1. Visit the state's Online Voter Registration System to complete a voter registration form online
  2. Print, sign, and mail the application to the address provided.
  3. If you have never registered before, you must provide copies of proof of photo identification OR proof of residency that shows your name and address with your application; otherwise, you must provide them the first time you vote in a Federal election.

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be a Florida resident.
  • Be at least 18 years old. You can pre-register to vote at 16 years old, but you'll need to wait until you're 18 years old to vote.
  • Have never been legally judged ineligible to vote, for either mental incapacitation or crime.
  • Have not been convicted of a felony and had your civil rights restored.
  • Must register at least 29 days before an election to be able to vote.
states.online: none
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Valid Florida Driver License or Florida identification Card Number

Steps

  1. Print Florida Voter Registration Application (Form DS-DE 39) here
  2. Complete the form.
  3. Return form to the following:
    • your local county Supervisor of Elections
    • A FLHSMV driver's license office.
    • A voter registration agency.
    • An armed forces recruitment office.
    • Any public library.
states.mail:
Items required

  • Valid Florida Driver License or Florida identification Card Number

Steps

  1. Print Florida Voter Registration Application (Form DS-DE 39) here
  2. Complete the form.
  3. Mail form to your local county Supervisor of Elections. Addresses found here

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Legal resident of a Georgia county.
  • At least 17 1/2 years old. You must be 18 years old before or on Election Day.
  • Have not been deemed by a judge to be mentally incompetent.
  • Not incarcerated, on parole or on probation for a felony conviction.
states.online:
Items required

  • Valid Georgia driver's license or ID card.

Steps

  1. Visit the state's Online Voter Registration System and follow the prompts as you complete the online form.
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Valid Georgia driver's license or ID card.

Steps

  1. Go to the Georgia Department of Driver Services (DDS) when you apply for your GA driver's license or renew your GA driver's license.
states.mail:
Items required

  • Valid Georgia driver's license or ID card.

Steps

  1. Obtain the State of Georgia Application for Voter Registration from
    • Downloading the form here
    • Your county board of registrar's office, or
    • The public library, or
    • Public assistance offices, or
    • Colleges and universities, or
    • Other government offices, or
  2. Complete the form.
  3. Mail the application to the address on the form.

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • A Hawaii resident
  • You're at least 18 years old, or will be at the time of election. You can pre-register at 16 years old, but you can't actually vote until you turn 18 years old.
  • NOT be currently incarcerated
  • If you are a felon, your sentence must have been suspended, regardless of whether you're placed on probation, or you've been paroled after completing their imprisonment.
states.online:
Items required

  • Your current Hawaii Driver's License or Hawaii State ID card
  • Your Social Security Number

Steps

  1. Visit the state's Online Voter Registration System and follow the prompts as you complete the online form.
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Proof of photo identification such as your Hawaii driver's license or ID card, or
  • Document that show both your name and address such as current utility bill, current bank statement, current government or other paycheck.

Steps

  1. Obtain the Voter Registration and Permanent Absentee Form from
    • Downloading the form here
    • Public libraries, or
    • City halls, or
    • Phone directories, or
    • U.S. post offices, or
    • University of Hawaii systems, or
    • Register in person at any city or county clerks office or at the Office of Elections location
  2. Complete the form.
  3. Return it to the county elections offices listed on the application.
states.mail:
Items required

  • Proof of photo identification such as your Hawaii driver's license or ID card, or
  • Document that show both your name and address such as current utility bill, current bank statement, current government or other paycheck.

Steps

  1. Obtain the Voter Registration and Permanent Absentee Form from
    • Downloading the form here
    • Public libraries, or
    • City halls, or
    • Phone directories, or
    • U.S. post offices, or
    • University of Hawaii systems
  2. Complete the form.
  3. Mail it to the county elections offices listed on the application.

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Have resided in Idaho and in the county for thirty (30) days prior to the day of election
  • Be at least 18 years old
  • You have not been convicted of a felony and have had your civil rights restored.
states.online: none
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • A copy of a current and valid photo identification or a copy of a current utility bill, bank statement, government check, paycheck or government document that shows your name and address must be submitted with this form or shown at the polls prior to voting

Steps

  1. You can register at the polls on Election Day if you bring proof of ID and Idaho residency, or
  2. Obtain Idaho Voter Registration Form (Form ERM-1) here
  3. Complete the form.
  4. Return form to the applicable county election office listed on the application.
states.mail:
Items required

  • A copy of a current and valid photo identification or a copy of a current utility bill, bank statement, government check, paycheck or government document that shows your name and address must be submitted with this form or shown at the polls prior to voting

Steps

  1. Obtain Idaho Voter Registration Form (Form ERM-1) here
  2. Complete the form.
  3. Mail form to the applicable county election office listed on the application.

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • You must be 17 years old on or before the date of the Primary Election and turn 18 on or before the date of the General Election.
  • You must live in your election precinct at least 30 days prior to Election Day.
  • Not be convicted and in jail.
  • Not claim the right to vote anywhere else.
states.online:
Items required

  • Your Illinois Drivers License or Illinois State ID number.
  • Date the license or ID was issued.
  • The last four digits of your social security number.

Steps

  1. Visit the state's Online Voter Registration System and follow the prompts as you complete the online form.
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Valid Illinois Drivers License or Illinois State ID number and 2 documents proving identification. 1 document must show your current address, or
  • The last 4 digits of your SSN and a valid photo identification, and a copy of a document proving your residential address

Steps

You can register to vote in person at:

  • Board of Election Commissioner's Office.
  • County Clerk's Office
  • City and Village Offices.
  • Military Recruitment Offices.
  • Township Offices.
  • Schools
  • Public Libraries.
states.mail:
Items required

  • Valid Illinois Drivers License or Illinois State ID number and 2 documents proving identification. 1 document must show your current address, or
  • The last 4 digits of your SSN and a valid photo identification, and a copy of a document proving your residential address

Steps

  1. Obtain Illinois Voter Registration Application (Form SBE R-19) here
  2. Complete the form.
  3. Mail form to your local election authority. Address found here

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • You are both a U.S. citizen and a resident of Indiana.
  • You will be at least 18 years of age on or before the next General or Municipal Election.
  • You are not currently in prison after being convicted of a crime.
  • You have lived in the precinct where you vote for at least 30 days prior to the election
states.online:
Items required

  • valid Indiana driver’s license
  • Indiana state-issued identification card (In lieu of drivers license)

Steps

  1. Visit this website
  2. Fillout the online registration form above
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • State voter registration form (VRG-7)
  • County voter registration form (VRG-11)

Steps

  1. Download and fillout this form
  2. Return the completed form to your county’s voter registration office or the Indiana Election Division.
  3. You can also apply in person at the voter registration or county clerk’s office, or apply in person at any BMV license branch.
  4. Once you registration form is received it will be processed.
  5. If the form is accepted a voter registration acknowledgment card will be sent to your address.
  6. If the form is denied a notice will be sent to your address.
states.mail:
Items required

  • State voter registration form (VRG-7)
  • County voter registration form (VRG-11)

Steps

  1. Download and fillout this form
  2. Return the completed form to your county’s voter registration office or the Indiana Election Division using the mailing addresses on the form.
  3. Once you registration form is received it will be processed.
  4. If the form is accepted a voter registration acknowledgment card will be sent to your address.
  5. If the form is denied a notice will be sent to your address.

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be a resident of Iowa.
  • Be at least 17 1/2 years old. You must be at least 18 years old by the election date to be able to vote.
  • NOT be registered to vote in any other state.
  • NOT be incarcerated, on parole, on probation, or have outstanding monetary obligations from your felony conviction.
  • NOT be judged mentally incompetent to vote by a court.
states.online:
Items required

  • valid Iowa driver’s license or ID number

Steps

  1. Visit this website
  2. Fillout the online registration form.
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Registration form.

Steps

  1. Download this form.
  2. Bring the form to your county auditor’s office.
  3. Please note that the form must be signed.
  4. Your county auditor will send you a voter registration card within two weeks if the form is accepted.
  5. Pre-registration must be completed 10 days before general elections or 11 days before all other elections.
states.mail:
Items required

  • Registration form.

Steps

  1. Download this form.
  2. Mail the form to your county auditor’s office.
  3. Please note that the form must be signed.
  4. Your county auditor will send you a voter registration card within two weeks if the form is accepted.
  5. Pre-registration must be completed 10 days before general elections or 11 days before all other elections.

Additionally you can register at the polls on election day if you an Iowa drivers license or the following forms of ID.

  • Iowa non-driver ID card
  • Out-of-state driver's license or non-driver ID card
  • U.S. passport
  • U.S. military ID
  • ID card issued by employer
  • Student ID issued by Iowa high school or college

If that form does not include an address you will need a proof of residence such as the following:

  • Residential lease
  • Utility bill (including a cell phone bill)
  • Bank statement
  • Paycheck
  • Government check or other government document

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be a resident of Kansas.
  • Be at least 17 years old (and 18 years old by Election Day to vote).
  • NOT be disqualified to vote by a court, due to mental incompetence.
  • NOT be registered to vote in another state.
  • NOT be incarcerated, on parole or on probation for a felony conviction.
states.online:
Items required

  • A Kansas driver's license or non-driver ID card
  • Proof of your U.S. residency, if registering for the first time

Steps

  1. Visit this website
  2. Fillout the online registration form.
  3. Scan you proof of citizenship, then email the copy to your county election office
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Registration form.
  • Proof of U.S. citizenship

Steps

  1. Download this form.
  2. Bring the form to your county election officer's office.
  3. Please note that the form must be signed.
  4. Your county auditor will send you a voter registration card within two weeks if the form is accepted.
  5. Pre-registration must be completed 10 days before general elections or 11 days before all other elections.
states.mail:
Items required

  • Registration form.
  • Proof of U.S. citizenship

Steps

  1. Download this form.
  2. Mail the form to your county election officer's office.
  3. Please note that the form must be signed.
  4. Your county auditor will send you a voter registration card within two weeks if the form is accepted.
  5. Pre-registration must be completed 10 days before general elections or 11 days before all other elections.

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be a resident in Kentucky for at least 28 days.
  • You're at least 18 years old (or will be by the date of the next general election). If you'll be 18 years old by the November general election date, you are eligible to vote in the May primary election.)
  • You have not been deemed mentally incompetent and had your voting rights revoked.
  • NOT have been convicted for a felony.
states.online:
Items required

  • Social Security Number
  • Date of Birth

Steps

  1. Visit this website
  2. Fillout the online registration form.
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Registration form.

Steps

  1. Download this form.
  2. Bring the filled in form to your county clerk's office.
states.mail:
Items required

  • Registration form.

Steps

  1. Download this form.
  2. Bring the filled in form to your county clerk's office.

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • You're a Louisiana resident in the parish in which you want to vote.
  • You're at least 17 years old, and will be 18 years old in time for the election
  • NOT deemed mentally incompetent or otherwise had your voting rights suspended under judgment.
  • NOT ot currently incarcerated, on parole, or on probation for a felony conviction.
states.online:
Items required

  • Driver's license number or special identification card number
  • Audit code
  • Social Security number

Steps

  1. Visit this website
  2. Fillout the online registration form.
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Registration form.
  • Proof of U.S. citizenship

Steps

  1. Download this form.
  2. Bring the form to your Registrar of Voters' office.
  3. You must bring roof of age, residency and identity.
states.mail:
Items required

  • Registration form.
  • Proof of U.S. citizenship

Steps

  1. Download this form.
  2. Mail the form to your Registrar of Voters' office.
  3. You must bring roof of age, residency and identity.

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • You have a fixed residency in Maine.
  • You're 18 years old or will be by the next general election
states.online: none
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • ME driver's license or ID card number
  • The last 4 digits of your Social Security number (In lieu of license)

Steps

  1. Download this form.
  2. Bring the form to your Municipal Registrar's office.
states.mail:
Items required

  • ME driver's license or ID card number
  • The last 4 digits of your Social Security number (In lieu of license)

Steps

  1. Download this form.
  2. Mail the form to your Municipal Registrar's office.

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be a resident of Maryland.
  • Be at least 16 years old. You must be 18 years old to vote in an election
  • Convicted of buying or selling votes.
  • Disqualified to vote by a court (due to mental incompetency).
  • Currently incarcerated for a felony conviction.
states.online:
Items required

  • The MD MVA must have your name, date of birth, and ID number on file
  • You must provide the last 4 digits of your Social Security number

Steps

  1. Visit this website
  2. Fillout the online registration form above
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • None

Steps

  1. Download this form.
  2. Bring the form to your Local Board of Election's office.
  3. Once your application is processed, you'll receive a voter identification card within 3 weeks.
states.mail:
Items required

  • None

Steps

  1. Download this form.
  2. mail the form to your Local Board of Election's office.
  3. Once your application is processed, you'll receive a voter identification card within 3 weeks.

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be a resident of Massachusetts.
  • Be At least ​16 years old to pre-register. (To vote you must be 18 years old on or before Election Day).
  • Are not currently incarcerated due to a felony conviction.
states.online:
Items required

  • A valid driver's license or learner's permit issued by Massachusetts
  • A valid non-driver ID card issued by Massachusetts (In lieu of a drivers license)
  • Have your signature on record at the MA Registry of Motor Vehicles

Steps

  1. Visit this website
  2. Fillout the online registration form above
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • None

Steps

  1. Visit your Local Election office. and ask to register to vote.
  2. When registering to vote in person, you'll fill out an affidavit of registration. You must answer all questions truthfully.
  3. If you are registering to vote for the first time in MA, you must attach a proof of ID to your voter registration form.
states.mail:
Items required

  • None

Steps

  1. Download this form.
  2. mail the form to your Local Election office.
  3. Your confirmation notice will be mailed to you.
  4. If you are registering to vote for the first time in MA, you must attach a proof of ID to your voter registration form.

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be a resident of Michigan, and of the city/township you're registering in.
  • Be at least 18 years old by the next election date
  • NOT currently imprisoned for a felony offense.
states.online: none
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Michigan driver license or personal ID card
  • Last four digits of your SSN

Steps

  1. Download this form.
  2. Bring the form to your Local or township Clerk.
  3. Once your form has been processed, your city or township clerk will issue you a MI voter identification card.
  4. If you're registering for the first time and submitting your application by mail, you will be required to submit a copy of your photo identification.
states.mail:
Items required

  • None

Steps

  1. Download this form.
  2. mail the form to your Local Election office.
  3. Your confirmation notice will be mailed to you.
  4. If you are registering to vote for the first time in MA, you must attach a proof of ID to your voter registration form.

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be at least 18 years old.
  • Ba a 20 day Minnesota resident.
  • NOT been convicted of a disqualifying felony.
states.online:
Items required

  • Valid Minnesota driver's license or identification card
  • You may use your Social Security number if you do not have a lisence or identification card

Note that you can register in person on election day. You will need to bring an official photo id (such as your driver's lisence or U.S. Passport)

Steps

  1. Visit the state's Electronic Voter Registration Application and follow the prompts as you complete the online form.
states.inPerson: none
states.mail:
Items required

  • Valid Nebraska driver's license or identification card
  • You may use your Social Security number if you do not have a lisence or identification card

Note that you can register in person on election day. You will need to bring an official photo id (such as your driver's lisence or U.S. Passport)

Steps

  1. Obtain State of Minnesota Mail-In Voter Registration Form by filling out and printing an online form request.
  2. Complete State of Minnestota Mail-In Voter Registration Form.
  3. Return form to your county Election Office or the state Secretary of State Office

  3. Return form to your local Election authority.

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be at least 18 years old.
  • Be a 30 day Montana Resident.
  • NOT been convicted of a disqualifying felony.
  • NOT be declared mentally incompetent by a court.
states.online: none
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Valid Montana driver's license or identification card
  • You may use your Social Security Number if you do not have a lisence

Steps

Note that you may fill out a registration form when you apply for or renew your driver's license or State of Montana ID at the office where you apply for or renew your Montana driver’s license.

  1. Visit your county election office Monday through Friday between the hours of 8 a.m. and 5 p.m. and complete a registration form
  2. Fill out and sign a voter registration application and drop it off at your county election office, or mail it to the county election administrator.
  3. Return form to your county Election Official
states.mail:
Items required

  • Valid Montana driver's license or identification card
  • You may use your Social Security Number if you do not have a lisence

Steps

  1. Obtain State of Montana Mail-In Voter Registration Form by filling out and printing an online form request.
  2. Complete State of Montana Mail-In Voter Registration Form.
  3. Return form to your county Election Administrator

  3. Return form to your county Election Official
  4. You can also receive a paper form at the following places:
    • County Election Office
    • Dpartment of Motor Vehicles Office
    • Libraries
    • Post Offices
    • Other offices that offer state public assistance

Items required

  • Social Security Number

Steps

  3. Return form to your county Election Official
  4. You can also receive a paper form at the following places:
    • County Election Office

    • Other offices that offer state public assistance

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be at least 18 years old.
  • Be a 30 day Nevada resident.
  • Must be residing in the County you are registering in when you are voting
states.online:
Items required

  • Valid Nevada driver's license or identification card

Steps

  1. Visit the state's Electronic Voter Registration Application and follow the prompts as you complete the online form. Note that this service is not always available (see site for more infomration).
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Valid Nebraska driver's license or identification card

Steps

  1. Obtain State of Nevada Mail-In Voter Registration Form by filling out and printing the online form request
  2. Complete State of Nevada Mail-In Voter Registration Form.
  3. Return form to your county's clerk or Registar of Voters
states.mail:
Items required

  • Valid Nevada driver's license or identification card

Steps

  1. You can receive and fill out a paper form at the following places:
    • Dpartment of Motor Vehicles Office
    • County clerk or Registrar of Voter's Office
    • Various Social Service Agencies
    • College Campuses

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be at least 18 years old.
  • Must be residing in the County you are registering in when you are voting at least 10 days before the election.
states.online: none
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Valid New Hampshire driver's license or identification card

Note that you may register in person at the polling place on election day. In this case, you will be asked to show proof of age, citizenship and domicile.

Steps Otherwise

  1. Apply to your town or city clerk’s office. You will be required to fill out a standard voter registration form and will be required to show proof of age, citizenship and domicile.
  2. It may be easier for you to register with your community’s Supervisors of the Checklist. By law, they are required to meet on the Saturday 10 days prior to each election. Check the local newspaper(s) or call your clerk’s office for the date and time of such meeting.
  3. Complete State of Nevada Mail-In Voter Registration Form.

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen for at least one month.
  • Be an Pennsylvania resident, for at least 30 days before the next election.
  • Be at least 18 years old.
  • NOT been convicted of a disqualifying felony.
states.online:
items required

  • PA driver's liciense or PennDot ID card number or Social security number

Steps

  1. visit this website to register.
states.inPerson:
items required

  • PA driver's liciense or PennDot ID card number or Social security number

Steps

  1. fill out the Pennsylvania Voter Registration Mail Application Form
  2. take the completed form to your county voter registration office
  3. Once your voter registration office processes your application, you will be sent a voter identification card by mail. If you do not receive your PA voter ID card within 14 days, you should contact your county voter registration office directly.
states.mail:
items required

  • PA driver's liciense or PennDot ID card number or Social security number

Steps

  1. fill out the Pennsylvania Voter Registration Mail Application Form
  2. send the completed form to your county voter registration office
  3. Once your voter registration office processes your application, you will be sent a voter identification card by mail. If you do not receive your PA voter ID card within 14 days, you should contact your county voter registration office directly.
states.absentee:
items required

  • Registered to vote in the state of Pennsylvania
  • The Absentee ballot must be Received by 5:00 p.m. on the Tuesday before Election Day

Steps

  1. Make sure you're registered to vote in the state of Pennsylvania
  2. Go to this website and fill out the form appropriately
  3. Send in your application before the 5 p.m. on the Tuesday before Election day

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be an Rhode Island resident.
  • Be at least 16 years old(you must be 18 years old to atually vote on election day).
  • NOT been convicted of a disqualifying felony.
  • Not deemed mentally incompetent by the court
states.online:
Items required

  • Some form of identification such as DMV-issued driver's license or RI DMV-ID number.

Steps

  1. visit this website to register.
  2. you can check your voter registration status with the registration tool on the website
states.inPerson:
items required

  • Some form of identification such as DMV-issued driver's license or RI DMV-ID number.

Steps

  1. fill out the Rhode Island Voter Registration Form
  2. take the completed form to your county voter registration office
  3. Once your voter registration office processes your application, you will be sent a voter identification card by mail. If you do not receive your PA voter ID card within 14 days, you should contact your county voter registration office directly.
states.mail:
items required

  • PA driver's liciense or PennDot ID card number or Social security number

Steps

  1. fill out the Rhode Island Voter Registration Form
  2. mail application form to your county's board of canvassers. If you're a first time voter you need to provide ID as well

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be an Wyoming resident.
  • Be at least 18 years old on election day).
  • NOT been convicted of a disqualifying felony.
  • Not deemed mentally incompetent by the court
states.online: none
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Proof of Identification which includes
    • Wyoming driver's license
    • Valid U.S passport
    • School or military ID

Steps

  1. If possible, fill out the Wyoming Voter Registration Application and Change Form before you visit the office, to save you time when you get there.
  2. Register in person with your local town or city clerk
states.mail:
Items required

  • Proof of Identification which includes
    • Wyoming driver's license
    • Valid U.S passport
    • School or military ID

Steps

  1. Print or get a copy of the Wyoming Voter Registration Application and Change Form.
  2. You have to fill out the Wyoming Voter Registration Application and Change Form in front of a notary or registry agent
  3. Have the Representitive sign your form and make copies of your proof of ID
